title: How to Shampoo Your Rabbit with Squeaky Clean Critter Shampoo

steps.headline: Collect everything from the "Things You Need" list.
Place the towel on your lap.
Have the rabbit sit on your lap.
steps.description: You can always do this step with your rabbit on the floor, but it  will be messier and your rabbit may try to run away.

steps.headline: Spray the rabbit with the shampoo.
steps.description: Make sure to avoid your rabbit's ears, mouth, eyes, and nose as these areas are very sensitive.

steps.headline: Massage the shampoo into your rabbits fur.
Lightly dry the rabbit with the towel.
steps.description: During the summer and hotter weather, this step isn't as important while during the cooler winter, you don't want your rabbit to freeze.

steps.headline: Put the rabbit back in his/her cage.
steps.description: Now you have a clean rabbit!

tyn: A carrot or other rabbit treat
text: Collect everything from the "Things You Need" list.  Place the towel on your lap.  Have the rabbit sit on your lap. You can always do this step with your rabbit on the floor, but it  will be messier and your rabbit may try to run away. Spray the rabbit with the shampoo. Make sure to avoid your rabbit's ears, mouth, eyes, and nose as these areas are very sensitive. Massage the shampoo into your rabbits fur.  Brush your rabbit's fur.  Lightly dry the rabbit with the towel. During the summer and hotter weather, this step isn't as important while during the cooler winter, you don't want your rabbit to freeze. Put the rabbit back in his/her cage. Now you have a clean rabbit!
sentences: Collect everything from the "Things You Need" list.
Place the towel on your lap.
Have the rabbit sit on your lap.
You can always do this step with your rabbit on the floor, but it  will be messier and your rabbit may try to run away.
Spray the rabbit with the shampoo.
Make sure to avoid your rabbit's ears, mouth, eyes, and nose as these areas are very sensitive.
Massage the shampoo into your rabbits fur.
Lightly dry the rabbit with the towel.
During the summer and hotter weather, this step isn't as important while during the cooler winter, you don't want your rabbit to freeze.
Put the rabbit back in his/her cage.
Now you have a clean rabbit!
